location_notes: Recent transplant to New York; loves NYC
Previously a resident of California for ~20 years; lived in Michigan intermittently ~2 years for graduate studies

moved_to_us.context: Moved to the US the day Nasdaq hit its peak during the tech bubble; followed then-girlfriend (now wife) to Cincinnati for her graduate studies.

athletics: First marathon was life-changing: proved he can finish anything he puts his mind into
fun_fact: Hot wings eating champion in college; can eat very spicy food

preferred_working_hours.after_hours: Can jump on a quick call after 21:00 ET if needed

feedback_preferences.source: Welcomes candid feedback regardless of hierarchy
feedback_preferences.cadence: Proactively requests written 360 feedback quarterly/semi-annually; shares findings with team

needs: Downtime after ~3–4 hours of meetings or deep work
struggles_with: Instant decision making without deep thinking
Presentation format for deep work and thinking
Meetings for the sake of meetings
data.mission_statement: Do the best work. Create future leaders. Learn new things, grow, have fun!

dataecutive_summary: CMO, CloudBees (2023–present): hired to rebuild the marketing organization from the ground up.
Builder/Advisor, Sequoia Capital (2023–present): advises founders on hiring, marketing, and GTM strategy.

CMO & Board Advisor, 1Password (2020–2023): first CMO; built marketing org to 70+; helped raise $920M at $6.7B valuation; grew B2B funnel to 100k+ customers; launched ad with Ryan Reynolds; helped prep org for IPO; Forbes Cloud 100 recognition in 2022.
CMO & VP, Prisma Cloud (Palo Alto Networks) (2020–2021): built PLG/growth marketing; supported Bridgecrew acquisition; repositioned messaging.

Head of Marketing, Atlassian (2014–2020): led marketing for Trello/Confluence/Bitbucket/Jira suite; integrated Trello post-acquisition; launched Stride; repositioned Bitbucket; drove growth and brand campaigns.

Earlier: Head of Marketing (SendHub, Cask); PMM (Google Enterprise / Google Cloud Platform); Marketing Manager (Cisco Small Business); Product Manager Intern (Amazon S3); Senie Engineer (Network Equipment Technologies).
education: MBA (Marketing & Corporate Strategy), University of Michigan Ross School of Business (2004–2006)
B.S./B.E. Electronics & Communications/Telecom Engineering, Jadavpur University (1994–1998)
publications: Outbound Fury: How to Engineer Virality, Displace Competitors & Win Hearts
Scaling a Product-Led Growth Model with 1Password, Apollo.io, Sentry, and Lightspeed

pil: Radical candor (candid feedback delivered with care)
Equity / inclusion (everyone has a seat at the table)
data.content_channel: Outbound Fury (Substack): long-form marketing strategy, leadership, and growth; introduces 'Outbound Fury' as being aggressive/consistent in outbound motion and public presence.

sources.doc: Raj Sarkar – Comprehensive Public Knowledge Base.pdf
Raj Sarkar – Comprehensive Public Knowledge Base.pdf

data.assessment: FIRO Business Leadership Report with FIRO Business Profile
high_level_interpretation: High involvement: prefers active participation; likes contributions from everyone; enjoys high-profile work and recognition.
High influence: likes structured situations; clear authority/responsibility; wants to make impact.
High connection: prefers warmth; open/supportive atmosphere; appreciates honest communication.
Overall high: works effectively in groups; considers self extroverted.

differentiating_strengths: Charismatic, innovative, highly relational; creates positive, inclusive, high-energy environment.
Exceptional marketing craft; approachable; people feel safe; builds trust quickly.
Genuinely cares about team growth and wellbeing; protects team publicly and gives honest feedback privately.
Authentic, grounded, deeply human; communicates honestly and directly without manipulation or hidden agendas.
Future-facing experimenter; energized by change; motivates without fear; creates followership.
Enterprise-minded values: fairness, transparency, accountability, respect; gives credit, takes responsibility.
areas_for_development: Increase executive presence, enterprise visibility, and strategic authority (speak up earlier/more forcefully; connect vision to operational reality).
Build operational depth, detail discipline, and follow-through (numbers, capacity, timelines; structured operational reviews).
Increase communication discipline and predictability (earlier heads-ups; clearer expectations; fewer last-minute pivots).
recommendations: Strengthen executive presence + enterprise leadership; uplift 1:many presentations; increase customer visibility.
Build operational rigor and detail mastery; inspect early/often; step in with facts/ownership when challenged.
Shift from improvised to intentional communication; improve predictability.

data.note: Resolution to focus on holistic health; cut down carbs/sugars and alcohol; increased activity; saw improvements in mental and physical health.
